question.body: Why would this reaction be classified as a hydrolysis reaction?

multiple_choice.choice: An amide was added to break the chemical bond.
Water is added to create a new bond in a bigger molecule.
Water is added to break a chemical bond and create two smaller molecules.
Water breaks a chemical bond by adding an entire water molecule to one of the two new smaller molecules.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The amide is the molecule whose chemical bond is being broken. Water is the molecules that is being added to break it.
Incorrect. Water is added to break a chemical bond and results in the degradation of a large molecule.
Correct. Hydrolysis is the process of bond being broken by water and two smaller molecules being formed.
Incorrect. In hydrolysis, water is broken into H+ and OH- . One of the smaller molecules receives the H+ and one receives the OH-.
